intro: Brachystelma lancasteri, commonly known as the Lancaster's ice plant, is a succulent species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically during the winter months. Its leaves are thick and succulent, adapted to store water in arid environments. Brachystelma lancasteri is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
